The friend's perspective that he's in the wrong because he didn't pay is missing the point. The core issue is the Domme's failure to respect the safe word and the resulting harm. In terms of legal and ethical standards, when a service provider fails to adhere to agreed-upon safety protocols and causes harm, the client isn't obligated to pay. The author's priority was his health, which is reasonable. The Domme's actions were inconsiderate and dangerous, so the author isn't in the wrong for not paying.
